member.name: T:BND.Services.Security.OTP.Api.Utils.ApiGlobalPrefixRouteProvider
member.summary:
Class ApiGlobalPrefixRouteProvider is a routing config provider to control any controller which use route attribute to go the same way. This class provides base route for any action of any controller, so you just set route after base route + controller name following:
base route = "Api"
controller name = "TestController"
So if sets route attribute to be [Route("{id}/Foo")] on your action, uri will be "http:your-domain.com/Api/Test/{id}/Foo", you dont need to set whole uri path on Route attribute like [Route("Api/Test/{id}/Foo")]

member.name: F:BND.Services.Security.OTP.Api.Utils.ApiGlobalPrefixRouteProvider._globalPrefix
member.summary: The global prefix route.

member.name: M:BND.Services.Security.OTP.Api.Utils.ApiGlobalPrefixRouteProvider.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:BND.Services.Security.OTP.Api.Utils.ApiGlobalPrefixRouteProvider.GetRoutePrefix(System.Web.Http.Controllers.HttpControllerDescriptor)
member.summary: Gets the route prefix from the provided controller.
